name: @microfox/brave
title: Brave SDK
description: The Brave SDK for TypeScript provides convenient access to various Brave APIs, including web, image, video, news, and local search functionalities, as well as summarization, spell check, and suggestions.

all_readmes.description: The batch processing functionality allows you to process multiple requests sequentially with configurable delays and progress tracking. This is particularly useful for handling rate limits and managing multiple API calls efficiently.
Creates a new instance of the Brave SDK.
The Brave SDK allows you to configure custom headers for API requests. Headers can be set either manually or using helper functions.
The `imageSearch` function enables image search capabilities through the Brave Search API, allowing you to find and retrieve images based on search queries.
The `localDescriptionsSearch` function enables searching for local descriptions using the Brave Search API, allowing you to retrieve detailed information about specific locations based on their IDs.

keyInstructions.setupInfo:
To use the Brave SDK, you need to obtain an API key (X-Subscription-Token) by subscribing to a plan (including the free plan) at https://brave.com/search/api/.

Once you have your API key, you can use it to initialize the SDK:

```typescript
import { createBraveSDK } from '@microfox/brave';

const braveSDK = createBraveSDK({
  apiKey: 'your-api-key-here',
});
```

Alternatively, you can set the API key as an environment variable:

```
BRAVE_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
```

And then initialize the SDK without passing the API key:

```typescript
const braveSDK = createBraveSDK();
```

The SDK will automatically use the API key from the environment variable if it's not provided in the constructor.

Note: Some endpoints require specific subscription plans (e.g., Pro plan for Local Search, Pro AI plan for Summarizer). Make sure you have the appropriate subscription for the endpoints you intend to use.
